data.text: In this page i explain every part of config.yml in order to get more informations about the avaiable options and all the possible configurations.
Is possible configure what type of database you prefer. The possible choice are:

items.content: H2: is a database file based, is used for store limited informations. Not suitable for heavy workloads or large datasets in production environments. If you have to much players i not recommend this type of database.
YAML: is a file used for store informations. If you want see your data with not to much problem and for backup is the perfect choice! Sometimes fails with to much data to update.

SqLite: is a database file based, is used for store informations. Ideal for small and medium-sized applications. SQLite is slightly slower than fully in-memory databases such as H2, but is very performant for read operations.

data.text: Is possible configure in wich worlds you want spawn the generators. The "Blacklist" boolean option is for choice the "Whitelist" or the "Blacklist", and the "List" is for write what world you want or not want.
How you want open interface? You can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">InterfaceOpen </font>options.

items.content: Shift + Right Click: in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and right click on the frame of generator;
Shift + Left Click: in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and left click on the frame of generator;
Shift + "": in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and right click or left click on the frame of generator;
Right Click: in this case for open the interface you have to right click on the frame of generator;
Left Click: in this case for open the interface you have to left click on the frame of generator;
Undefined: in this case for open the interface you have to right click or left click on the frame of generator;

data.text: You want an empty hand when open the interface? You can configure it in EmptyHand option.
<font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">P.S. Pay attention at this configurations!</font>
If you have this example of settings:
With this configuration if you click with the pickaxe or the sword with left click (as you would do for mining or killing) the plugin open the interface of the generator.
You want the items of generator is only for sell purpose? You can configure it in InterfaceItemTake option:

items.content: If you enable it is possible get the items in the generator interface;
If you disable it is not possible get the items in the generator interface;

data.text: You want limited item for slot in the generator? You can configure it in MaxItemForSlot option:

items.content: If you use -1 you have infinite items for each slot;
If you use any other number you have a limit defined from the number you writed;

data.text: "Unlimited" is the text dispalyed in the informations of Generator Interface, you can write what you want but if you don't have idea there are some here:

items.content: "Unlimited": write this if you use -1 for declaring infinite items such as: '-1:Unlimited';
A number: write the same number you chose as the limit such as: '64:64'
"?": if you don't want inform the player use it on how much is the limit, such as: '64:?'

data.text: In this case the limit is only your immagination :D
You want a limited number of slots usable in the generator? you can configure it in InterfaceSlots.Enabled option:

items.content: If you enable it you permit at all generators to have a number of limited slots configurable in InterfaceSlots.Default section;
If you disable it all the slots are unlocked, in this case the max number of slots is detected in the Interfaces section of config;

data.text: If you want upgrade the size of generator when reach the max level you can configure it in UpgradeSize section. This is a particular feature only for a Normal Generator (for more informations about the Normal Generator see the section Generators). When the player reach the last upgradable level if this feature is enable when upgrade the generator is deleted and the plugin give at the player a new generator of level 1 of the next size. Is possible also configure what is the next generator in the Generators section, and is possible configure the levels in generators.yml file
If you create a lot of levels and you want buy more levels insted one at time is possibile enable the FastUpgrade section. Also this feature is avaiable only for a Normal Generator.
In the ItemCollecting section is possible configure where you want the items:

items.content: Interface: this is the default configuration and all the above configurations regards this type of collecting;
Inventory: directly in the inventory of player;
Ground: dropped such as in Vanilla;

data.text: In this section is possible configure the Place and Disband Animations of Generator:

items.content: If the animations are enabled, at the disband and/or at the place you can see the creation or destroy of the generator piece by piece;
If the animations are disabled, at the disband and/or at the place you cannot see the any animation;

data.text: P.S. Pay attention at this configurations!
The animation garantee great performance instead the instant place of all blocks at the same time!
If you use really big sizes of generators is recommended the use of animations!
This configuration is for stablish who is the owner of generator:

items.content: If set true, the item who represent the Generator contains an NbtTag with the owner name obtained through commands, for example with the command "cg 3x3" executed by a player, give at player an item with here name registered. At place of generator the plugin controls if the player name and the owner name registered are the same;

if set false, the item who represent the Generator contains an NbtTag with the owner name obtained through commands, for example with the command "cg 3x3" executed by a player, give at player an item with here name registered. At place of generator the plugin not controls if the player name and the owner name registered are the same. This type of configuration is for permit at the player to sell the generator if it have a limited number of generator;

data.text: You want set a limited number of generators for player? Check the Configuration.MaxCubeGenerator for set it!

This configuration is for limit the number of generator the player can place. For example if you set this configuration at 2 and give at a player 3 generators, he can place only 2 generators, the third never can be placed.

CubeGenerator is a generator, not a mine! The plugin is born for customize blocks, mobs and drops, so if you don't want drop experience from any block you can disable this configuration, otherwise the plugin give at player the default minecraft experience.
You want customize the blocks of generator? Take a look at this section Configuration.Generators and at generator configuration page.
You want customize the generator with mobs? Take a look at this section Configuration.Generators and at mob generator configuration page.
